outline.title: Extension Architecture: Core Capabilities
outline.summary: First part covering three core extension components: Browser Automation (DeepTreeEchoBrowser) for web interaction and information gathering, ML Integration (Echo9ML) for statistical learning and neural processing, and Evolution Engine (EchoAgent) for genetic programming and optimization. Each component operates within the Extension Membrane as a sandboxed plugin with controlled access to core resources.
outline.image_plan: No images needed for this slide - focus on the three core extension components in a grid layout

outline.title: Extension Architecture: Monitoring and Interface Systems
outline.summary: Continuation covering three additional extension components: Introspection System (EchoselfIntrospection) for self-monitoring and debugging, Monitoring Dashboard (DeepEchoMonitor) for real-time system visibility and visualization, and Sensory Motor Interface (SensoryMotorBridge) for connecting cognitive system to physical sensors and actuators. These components complete the modular plugin system enabling specialized capabilities without core modification.

outline.title: Infrastructure Services: Core System Support
outline.summary: First part covering three foundational infrastructure services: P-System Membrane Manager (handles membrane lifecycle, creation, destruction, splitting, merging, hierarchy maintenance, and message routing), Communication Protocols (provides standardized inter-component messaging with serialization, routing, delivery guarantees, and both synchronous/asynchronous patterns), and Security & Validation (enforces system-wide policies including access control, input validation, output sanitization, and audit logging). These services operate transparently across all architectural layers.
outline.image_plan: No images needed - focus on the three core infrastructure services in a structured layout with technical annotations

outline.title: Infrastructure Services: Optimization and State Management
outline.summary: Continuation covering two additional infrastructure services: Performance Optimization (monitors resource usage including CPU, memory, and network; optimizes allocation through load balancing, caching, and garbage collection; prevents bottlenecks; operates continuously in background), and Version Control & Rollback (maintains versioned snapshots of system state; enables rollback to previous configurations; critical for autonomous learning systems that modify their own structure; supports temporal reasoning and safe experimentation). Bottom section emphasizes transparent operation principle: all infrastructure services work invisibly across layers, ensuring reliability without interfering with cognitive processing.
